On this page

  • Flipping ten coins, 400 times

Flipping ten coins, 400 times

This page lets you play with the CODAP file we used to create the final examples in the paper. You will see the Binomial Simulator, a table, and a graph, which we used to make Figure 5.

Here, we will make Figure 6! That is, we want to explore the probability of getting 5 girls in a family with 5 children.

Back to the main probability page

Here are things to do and play with:

  • Change the vocabulary to talk about children and families.
    • Change the basic event to child.
    • Change the possible result of one child to girl.
    • Change the alternative to boy.
    • And a set of 10 children is a family.
  • In the settings,
    • Ensure that the probability of a girl is 1/2.
    • Change the number of children in a family to 5.
  • Finally, press Engage. Because you changed the vocabulary, the entire dataset about coins gets erased.
  • Make a fresh graph (perhaps deleting the old one) and drag girl to the horizontal axis. You’ll see the distribution of number of girls. Notice how short “5” is.
  • This will make nicer graph:
